ygData.subject: Re: New Survey
ygData.msgSnippet: i believe the level caps would prevent the twinking more tehn anything ... i dislike the twinkies ... mostly from jealousy ... but ... i beleive it also
ygData.messageBody:
i believe the level caps would prevent the twinking more tehn anything ... i
dislike the twinkies ... mostly from jealousy ... but ... i beleive it also
enhances play also ...
-----Original Message-----
From: EverQuest-owner@... <EverQuest-owner@...>
To: EverQuest@onelist.com <EverQuest@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, August 02, 1999 5:07 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] New Survey


>From: EverQuest-owner@...
>
>Hello,
>
>There is a new survey for the EverQuest community.
>
>More and more items are becoming NO DROP now, meaning you cannot trade or
sell them, and since Verant pushes forward about the game having a "player
based economy", the NO DROP items really ruin this concept.. There is a way
to prevent "twinking" and still have the items availible for trade, an
alternative to NO DROP. Put level blocks on equipment, meaning you cannot
use/wear the equipment until you are high enough level for the item, the
level will be somewhere below the level you need to get it.
>
>
>----
>
>Possible answers are:
>
>o NO DROP is the way to go.
>o Hmm, level caps on items, that's better..
>o Why not both at once?
>
>
>To vote, please visit the following web page:
>
>http://www.onelist.com/surveycenter/EverQuest
>
>Note: Please do not reply to this message. Survey votes are not collected
>via email. To vote, you must go to the ONElist website.
>
>
>Thanks!
>
>EverQuest Owner
>
>
>--------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>

>If you join ONElistï¿½s FRIENDS & FAMILY program. For details, go to
>http://www.onelist.com/info/onereachsplash3.html
